comment.author: 41909278@N08
comment._content:
Showing off her blue and yellow trainer colours, this BT-14 was the result of the BT-9's (and all later models) to be modified by fitting parts from other NAA trainer types. For instance, NAA took a fabric covered BT-9B, substituted Harvard wings, tail assembly and canopy and got the BT-9D. Then by revising the wing, changing the engine to a P&W R-985 and applying metal fuselage panels, the BT-14 came into being.

Doug MacPhail
